questions.question: According to the speaker in “Sympathy,” how does the caged bird feel?

choices.answer: bright, springing, perfumed
alarmed, persecuted, fearful
constrained, oppressed, imprisoned
faint, clinging, ill

questions.question: Which of the following BEST explains the title “Sympathy”?

choices.answer: The speaker pities the caged bird because of its injuries.
The speaker also shares the caged bird’s desire for freedom.
The speaker is critical of the caged birds reasons 4 singing
The speaker admires the caged bird’s courage.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST paraphrases lines 10-11? The bird...

choices.answer: stays in cage since his injuries might cause him 2 faint
stays on his perch because he is afraid of the wind
must return 2 the perch tho he would rather be on the swing
must stay in cage tho he would rather be on a  tree branch
the bird is so crippled it will never b able 2 enjoy freedom
bird has not given up hope despite a lifetime of captivity
he could enjoy its captivity if only it would stop fighting
as the bird gets older, its desire for freedom increases

questions.question: The poet compares the caged bird’s song to a

choices.answer: lullaby.
symphony.
carol of joy.
prayer.
